results.content: Focused, short and to the point (there are no "How to install npm" lessons). The audio quality could be better in the first lessons. In general is great for the price.
results.content_html: Focused, short and to the point (there are no "How to install npm" lessons). The audio quality could be better in the first lessons. In general is great for the price.

results.content: My overall experience with this course was great. It was compact, focused on Saga, to the point and well organised. I learned something new about saga from this course.
results.content_html: My overall experience with this course was great. It was compact, focused on Saga, to the point and well organised. I learned something new about saga from this course.

results.content: I have developed several applications with Redux Saga but needed to quickly refresh my knowledge on best practises and this course was absolutely fantastic for this. The points are explained clearly.  I'd love to see more fast track courses like this.
results.content_html: I have developed several applications with Redux Saga but needed to quickly refresh my knowledge on best practises and this course was absolutely fantastic for this. The points are explained clearly. I'd love to see more fast track courses like this.

results.content:
The author has a clear and nice voice listening to, and good explanations for a topic I've struggled with and had a hard time finding good tutorials on. Finally, I've found one!

The "cheat sheet" in the end is very helpful. The pace is a bit quick sometimes, but you can always pause and scroll back to watch two times if you miss something on the first try. 

I didn't get the axios `withCredentials` property to work so I had to send them along with each request. I'm not sure if I maybe missed something there in the beginning. This needs to work in order for the API to behave correctly. So make sure you get it right!

And when you install bootstrap, make sure to restart the application or the CSS won't load properly.

This course is quite short compared to some others I've taken, and the good thing with that is that is focuses on Sagas and nothing else. You need to be very familiar with Redux and React before doing this course. But then again, there are A LOT of courses on those topics, so It's not really something I missed. 

A bit slower pace and perhaps higher resolution on the video would have been nice. Otherwise a really good course for anyone who wants to get into Redux Sagas!

response.content: Thank you for the positive review and feedback, Hanna. I'm happy the course helped you :)
response.content_html: Thank you for the positive review and feedback, Hanna. I'm happy the course helped you :)

results.content_html:
The author has a clear and nice voice listening to, and good explanations for a topic I've struggled with and had a hard time finding good tutorials on. Finally, I've found one!

The "cheat sheet" in the end is very helpful. The pace is a bit quick sometimes, but you can always pause and scroll back to watch two times if you miss something on the first try.

I didn't get the axios `withCredentials` property to work so I had to send them along with each request. I'm not sure if I maybe missed something there in the beginning. This needs to work in order for the API to behave correctly. So make sure you get it right!

And when you install bootstrap, make sure to restart the application or the CSS won't load properly.

This course is quite short compared to some others I've taken, and the good thing with that is that is focuses on Sagas and nothing else. You need to be very familiar with Redux and React before doing this course. But then again, there are A LOT of courses on those topics, so It's not really something I missed.

A bit slower pace and perhaps higher resolution on the video would have been nice. Otherwise a really good course for anyone who wants to get into Redux Sagas!

results.content: Till this point the course covers basics very well and gets you up and running very fast.
results.content_html: Till this point the course covers basics very well and gets you up and running very fast.

results.content:
Fast, efficient, focused on the topic at hand.

I would have liked a few more advanced examples (like manual saga cancellation for instance) but the docs cover those cases.

In less than a hour (if you skip the react stuff) you will know all the basics to manipulate sagas
results.content_html:

results.content:
I finished this course in one sitting, and I got great value from it. What I like most about it is the instructor wastes no time to get up and running with Redux Saga and its core features. Even the project setup did not take long at all.

This course covers everything we need to know about Redux Saga to build a CRUD app - which I think is enough. Basic knowledge of React, Redux and ES6 is assumed, so it's probably not for absolute beginners.

Other reviewers are right to point out that the screen did get a bit blurry at some points - but I could live with that. If anything, I do wish this course to be a bit longer and cover more advanced features. But I'm happy because it gives me a solid enough foundation to explore those on my own.

Thanks Tom!

response.content: Thanks for the positive review, Razwan. I'm really glad you found value in the course :) I believe the blurry video issue may be udemy's video player serving varying video quality depending on internet connection speed. I recorded and uploaded all videos in 1080p, however I will also look into this issue myself just in case. Do you happen to remember which particular lectures were causing problems? Thanks again! Tom.
response.content_html: Thanks for the positive review, Razwan. I'm really glad you found value in the course :) I believe the blurry video issue may be udemy's video player serving varying video quality depending on internet connection speed. I recorded and uploaded all videos in 1080p, however I will also look into this issue myself just in case. Do you happen to remember which particular lectures were causing problems? Thanks again! Tom.

This course covers everything we need to know about Redux Saga to build a CRUD app - which I think is enough. Basic knowledge of React, Redux and ES6 is assumed, so it's probably not for absolute beginners.

Other reviewers are right to point out that the screen did get a bit blurry at some points - but I could live with that. If anything, I do wish this course to be a bit longer and cover more advanced features. But I'm happy because it gives me a solid enough foundation to explore those on my own.

Thanks Tom!

results.content:
i found the course to be great.. I'm building an application at work which was using Redux-thunk and using what Tom has taught in the course I have remove Redux-Thunk in favour of Redux-Saga and clean up a lot of code.  
Another reason i like this course as it was only about Redux-Saga.  I didn't have watch 5hrs of React & Redux just to get to the part about Redux-Sagas.  It was only an afternoon watching and following along and now I feel that I understand Redux-Saga enough to actually use it in a application and know what I'm doing

Thanks Tom

response.content: Thanks for the review, Stefen! I also much prefer using Redux Saga over Redux Thunk.

results.content: This course is exactly what I needed. I hadn't used redux saga before and recently inherited a project that uses it and found it difficult to understand what was going on. This course has helped me a lot in understanding the basics of redux saga - the lecture on javascript generators and the cheat sheet is super helpful - especially the examples in the cheat sheet of when to use certain effects. Overall a great introduction to redux saga. Thanks Tom!

results.content:
The course is merely a single example written very fast by the author, without much explanation.
No best practices, no bad practices, not all methods reviewed. The methods reviewed are barely seen in context.
It required a mastery of redux to follow, but barely touches redux-saga, so it is both very complex and very simple at the same time. 
It is outdated since it uses create-react-app (without mentioning the version) and go on with classes component, but the latest create-react-app uses functional components, so it requires extra steps and knowledge to just get started.
There is only 1 visual aid, a cheap one, and is not of much use since it is not explained much.
It is really short, and contains many useless elements like UI building. So for the 1h30 maybe half is about redux-saga.
After realizing that it would never get into the details or the explanation, I was already past the no-return point for a refund.
Really disappointed. Very low quality. I would even be a little disappointed even if it was free on youtube. But for a paid course it's greatly lacking.

results.content: The instructor is good and has the perfect pace I need to understand the concepts. Not too fast, not too slow. I can start using sagas after the training. But just it. After it, you have to keep learning to implement other use cases. For example, a simple use case that is suitable for the example app... the app can allow to delete multiple users at same time but not listening more than one delete action for a single user. Another improvement that could be useful is just play with api delays so the student can see how sagas works and really does not listen another calls or just get the latest.

results.content:
I have a complex web UI build in Java using Vaadin and have decided on replacing it with React. There are tons of RESTful API calls which I plan to use Sagas to handle.

This course was great! The instructor was perfect in every regard (for me). He was no nonsense - fast paced, just focused on redux and sagas and just enough UI stuff to demonstrate the linkages. In one quick course (few hours) all of my questions about redux and sagas were answered.

results.content:
It meets my expectation.

the pace is fast, more suitable for an advance learner.

results.content:
A good course, would recommend it. Relative to other tutorials, it requires the student to pause a lot more to review and look at the larger-scale structure and connect intermediary steps. That requires more work on the student's part, which is probably a good thing actually. However it would be good for the instructor to explain this style a bit more at the outset. (Compare with Steven Grider's courses, which are much more fine-grained in their explanations and make fewer assumptions about the student's knowledge.)

One bit of negative feedback: the text size is small and low-contrast, which makes studying on smaller monitors difficult, especially since the student will half-screen to be able to code along.

Pros and cons of course.

Pros:

Cons:

results.content:
Great explanation of Redux Saga! It is a complicated technology to teach, but you did well. I can now jump into it and help my team implement this at work. 
This course is straight-forward and expects students to know Javascript and React-Redux before watching. This is good for people who want to learn Redux Saga fast! 
I appreciate your hard work! Thanks and keep making more guides!

To Tom Phillips: Please make sure your GitHub Source Code repository is updated with all the code which was shown in the last videos. I see it's missing some code in the reducers file which was already written in the last video... please check and update - https://github.com/tomphill/redux-saga-course

results.content: Short, crisp and to the point. This course is for ReactJS-Redux enthusiasts who would like to add Saga to their UI skills. Prior knowledge of React and Redux is essential.

results.content: The course is very much introductory. The course is not detailed enough to understand redux-saga fully. The app that we are making during course is not big enough to understand redux-saga. Only single app was made during course. It should have been like after the single app was made during learning then another app should have been made to check and understand are we able to apply redux-saga into new project or not.

response.content:
Hey, Anish! I really appreciate your review and rating on my Redux Saga course. I wanted to reach out to you to apologise for not delivering the course you expected. I remember when I first tried to get into redux saga it was a massive learning curve for me and there didn't seem to be any good material on how to quickly get up and running with it, or any breakdown or explanations of concepts, hence the idea for creating this fast-track course. I really hope I didn't mis-sell the course or was misleading in my description of the course. I really tried to place emphasis on it being a "quickly get up and running" introductory course so I apologise if it didn't come across that way. 

With that said, I believe everything I cover in the course covers most use-cases when using Redux Saga on a day to day basis. I agree, the app we create in this course is fairly basic, however the concepts are relevant and can be easily applied to larger apps as well.

If you're unhappy with the course and if you're unaware, I'd like to mention that udemy provide a 30 day no questions asked refund policy which you're more than welcome to take advantage of. This doesn't affect your review and rating in any way and they'll both remain public.

Thanks for taking the time to read this, and again I really do appreciate the feedback. All feedback I receive helps me improve as an instructor on this platform and will improve my future courses.

Thanks, Tom.
response.content_html:
Hey, Anish! I really appreciate your review and rating on my Redux Saga course. I wanted to reach out to you to apologise for not delivering the course you expected. I remember when I first tried to get into redux saga it was a massive learning curve for me and there didn't seem to be any good material on how to quickly get up and running with it, or any breakdown or explanations of concepts, hence the idea for creating this fast-track course. I really hope I didn't mis-sell the course or was misleading in my description of the course. I really tried to place emphasis on it being a "quickly get up and running" introductory course so I apologise if it didn't come across that way.

With that said, I believe everything I cover in the course covers most use-cases when using Redux Saga on a day to day basis. I agree, the app we create in this course is fairly basic, however the concepts are relevant and can be easily applied to larger apps as well.

If you're unhappy with the course and if you're unaware, I'd like to mention that udemy provide a 30 day no questions asked refund policy which you're more than welcome to take advantage of. This doesn't affect your review and rating in any way and they'll both remain public.

Thanks for taking the time to read this, and again I really do appreciate the feedback. All feedback I receive helps me improve as an instructor on this platform and will improve my future courses.

Thanks, Tom.

results.content: This course was a great intro to redux sagas, mainly because the instructor focuses mainly on the saga portion and doesn't spend too much time explaining redux and react. This is suitable for any developer who is already familiar with react and redux concepts and just needs the added knowledge. Would definitely recommend!

results.content: I thought this was well done and well organized. The instructions were clear and concise. I did not feel lost at any time through out the lectures. You definitely walk away with an understanding of redux sagas, it was greatly appreciated. This would have been amazing for me if there were another example or two, just to really drive it home while doing example based learning. Perhaps one that demonstrated the explanation of why the generator functions were so helpful. Maybe a bit more discussion on the saga workflow and some additional diagrams that would be helpful to recall the lessons.
results.content_html: I thought this was well done and well organized. The instructions were clear and concise. I did not feel lost at any time through out the lectures. You definitely walk away with an understanding of redux sagas, it was greatly appreciated. This would have been amazing for me if there were another example or two, just to really drive it home while doing example based learning. Perhaps one that demonstrated the explanation of why the generator functions were so helpful. Maybe a bit more discussion on the saga workflow and some additional diagrams that would be helpful to recall the lessons.

results.content: Good course. Probably the best thing I learned is "fork" helper theory and why we need to use it, to have separate threads for each saga and avoid crashing for all sagas (and if all sagas are crashed - entire application is crashed). Wanted to hear more about best practices and usage of saga in complex application, but for intro to redux saga enough content provided in this course.
results.content_html: Good course. Probably the best thing I learned is "fork" helper theory and why we need to use it, to have separate threads for each saga and avoid crashing for all sagas (and if all sagas are crashed - entire application is crashed). Wanted to hear more about best practices and usage of saga in complex application, but for intro to redux saga enough content provided in this course.

results.content:
Very good and simple explanations about Saga features and generated functions, plus some helpful tips about React.
Learned a lot and very fast.

results.content:
This is a good fast track course. However I would have loved to see a section on handling state which doesn't come from the api.  This is a very typical thing, and yes, simple, but it would have been nice to at least cover.

Also, it would have been good to show a clearer example of mapStateToProps and dispatchToProps which aligns more with its basic implementation.

Overall this course gave me a good overview of what I needed to learn, but even though its a fast track, there could have been a little more coverage.

- Maximum resolution of 720p is outdated and to low for the way the content is presented
- Audio-quality is awful. there is too much white noise and you can hear when the video was cut.
- Unacceptable format for smartphones. I choose Udemy because of it's app and offline functionality. In this course the relevant content is way too small for a smartphone.
- The actual content is 4 out of 5 stars

response.content: Hey, Florian. Thanks for the constructive feedback. Regarding the resolution, udemy currently only support a max resolution of 720p. This is site-wide and not specific to this course. Also when I recorded the course I didn't think many people would watch it on a smartphone. I was anticipating people watching on a desktop / laptop and coding along. Thanks again for your feedback and I'm happy you found the content useful.
